newsitem.title: USA: Sarcom raises $150 mln for national expansion.
newsitem.headline: Sarcom raises $150 mln for national expansion.

text.p: Sarcom Inc, a privately-held computer systems integrator, said on Monday it copmleted a $150 million recapitalization, for use in its national expansion strategy.

The company said McCown De Leeuw & Co, a private equity investment firm, made a substantial equity investment in Sarcom. The recapitalization provided Sarcom with over $65 million of available funds to pursue growth plans, it said.

To assist with plans, the company said it created a chief executive officer position and named Tom Taylor to the role. Taylor was one of the founders of ENTEX Information Services, which provides computer products and services.

Sarcom offers information technology solutions and services including network integration, installation and design, PC systems integration, help-desk serivces, hardware repair, training and outsourcing.
